result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Joseph Sikorski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash Bond previously posted in the amount of $200.00 has been applied.  The remaining balance of the Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Joseph Sikorski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned by USPS - Not deliverable as addressed - Unable to Forward

Case Called @ 1:32 PM: Defendant Peter Joseph Sikorski in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves another copy of S&C, copy returned from USPS.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel and requests to speak with the State on his own without counsel.  NGP entered by Court.   Off Record for Def to speak with ADA on resolution.  Back of Record at 2:42 PM:  Per ADA - resolution reached and recited.  States recommends Court Costs as penalty - no restitution being requested.  Def confirms recital.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed - VIS reviewed by Court. Plea Retail Theft:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  No statement offered by Def.  The Court:  Accepts resolution and imposes Court Costs only - DNA Sample ordered and sample to be provided.  Expungement of DNA record explained.  DNA Surcharge ordered - bond to be applied - 60 DTP Balance.  Appeal Rights Given.
